page.title: 04Historical Prendergast
page.content: {MAURICE de PRENDERGAST,}who was a Norman, settled in Prendergast in the year 1140. Thirty years later he went ( with Richard de Clare, nicknamed "Strongbow") to fight in Ireland; he was killed in battle there. A few centuries later a family called{STEPNEY}built a mansion in Prendergast and lived there from 1558, in the reign of Queen Elizabeth I, until 1669 in Charles II's reign. Prendergast was a village with a {BAD REPUTATION}_ the police would not visit it _ so criminals and debtors hid themselves there. The Mayor of Prendergast was chosen from the men who were most often{DRUNK throughout the year! After he was chosen he was driven into Haverfordwest in a horse and cart. In 1840 Prendergast became part of the Borough of Haverfordwest.
